text: by the time they get here there's one
choice refugees must pay the criminal

2016 the numbers trying to cross to
Europe have tripled compared to last
year and with rough winter cease prices
have more than half to around $700 the
smuggling mafia has offices in the
center of town where we secretly filmed
this man who calls himself abu safe and
boasts of his connections
what are you ready Gandhi and dim image
yeah oh I feel nothing do not worry when

trade
these Syrian refugee boys were selling

the oldest no more than 13 the youngest

undercover reporter
and the boy assured us there'd be no
danger of the boat breaking down what
boats do sink the drowning of three year
old Alan Kurdi last September sparked
brief outrage but the trade continues
overcrowded boats sinking on rough seas
as refugees tried to steer themselves
resisting the smugglers orders can be
perilous gula Stan Chico was afraid to

Sun rose we found the people on the

the majority here are women and children
from Iraq we're Iraqis we left our
country but we still love our country
the old man says when I left my home I
cried and I cried my family and my
children had left and I was alone there
the people here are now waiting for the
smugglers boat to arrive it's a journey
of over two and a half hours across the
Greece and once they're there the
journey into Europe begins the police
came trucky says it's clamping down on
smuggling there have been dozens of
arrests but not this time the police
went away then four vans appeared the
Turkish smugglers and their inflatable
boats seeing us they became angry
off-camera want pointed to his gun our
Turkish colleague translated and I will
take it out and shoot you so let's go we
hid behind rocks and witness the loading
of the refugees as the boats are
launched a smuggler jumps off the people
are on their own one boat breaks down a
man desperately tries to restart the
engine the other boat moves towards
Greece after nervous minutes the second
boat is on its way again war and the
failure of governments have left the
vulnerable at the mercy of criminals
Fergal keen BBC news
